title_full:
Ulla & Ultrafog

              —
              it means a lot
            
              (Motion Ward)
label: Motion Ward
description:
Fizzing thru the aether like a half-remembered dream, Ulla and Ultrafog's collaborative debut is a surreal shimmer of imploded shoegaze-y guitar riffs, thick subs and lassoed vocals. Like an especially dissociated strain of hypnagogic pop, its sequence of trace recollections netted into a syrup of entrancing and half-speed ambience comes highly recommended if you’ve enjoyed work by Perila, Romance, Vincent Gallo, claire rousay or Oval. 

Not quite as smoky and diaphanous as Ultrafog's... more

title_full:
urika's bedroom

            —
            Big Smile, Black Mire

Prophetic Justice Ministry

            —
            Prophetic Justice Ministry Vol​.​1

Jabu

              —
              A Soft and Gatherable Star
            
              (do you have peace?)
label: do you have peace?
description:
Jabu take a big leap skyward on a gorgeous new album of hazed dreampop and burnished bass inspired by classic Cocteau Twins via A.R. Kane - essential listening for fans of HTRK, Rat Heart Ensemble, YL Hooi.

Launching with a dampened crash and slo-mo thuds, 'Oceanside Spider House' is the ideal re-introduction to the Bristol trio of Amos Childs, Alex Rendall and Jasmine Butt, who built a cult following for their blown-out, hypnagogic dub diffractions on 2017's 'Sleep Heavy' for Blackest... more

title_full:
Tristwch y Fenywod

              —
              Tristwch y Fenywod
            
              (Night School)
label: Night School
description:
An utterly addictive masterpiece of Welsh-sung queer goth folk, the debut recording by Gwretsien Ferch Lisbeth (Guttersnipe, The Ephemeron Loop), Leila Lygad (Hawthonn) and Sidni Sarffwraig (Slaylor Moon, The Courtneys) is among this decade’s most bewitching albums, bar none - unmissable for fans of Cranes, Dead Can Dance, Svitlana Nianio, Cocteau Twins' 'Head Over Heels', The Cure's 'The Top' era.

Under a handle translating to ‘The Sadness of Women’, Tristwch Y Fenywod... more

title_full:
Glen Rey.

            —
            tomorrow once the rain stops

label: Knekelhuis
description:
Comprehensive first vinyl survey of neo-ambient, shoegaze and synth-pop singles by Helen Island, one of many projects revolving Léopold Collin (DJ Prince Scream, Radiante Pourpre, Violent Quand On Aime), and lodged somewhere amidst work by Bianca Scout, Shell Company, a.s.o., Malibu 

‘Last Liasse’ is the ultimate compilation of a series of releases thru the artist’s triggermoral recs in 2022-2023. Their dozen cuts add up to the project’s most significant session, joining dots between... more

label: Theory Therapy & co:clear
description:
Gorgeously blissed dreamweaving, right at the cusp of ambient and dissolved pop music underlaid with sumptuous subs, featuring guest contributions from k2dj, aka Ben Bondy, and tipped if yr into Malibu/DJ Lostboi, Bianca Scout, Space Afrika, Florian TM Zeisig, Ulla & Ultrafog, Grouper.

Issued via nascent labels co:clear (Glasgow) and Theory Therapy (Sydney), ’Shyness’ is a real gem distilled from aspects of ambient-pop, chamber music, and the liminal points where club echoes fade into the... more

label: AD 93
description:
Moin are Valentina Magaletti with Tom Halstead and Joe Andrews (Raime), and their third album of finely tempered post-hardcore expands their remit (and no doubt their reach) by adding original vocals by Coby Sey, Olan Monk, james k, and Sophia Al-Maria for a patented knit of wiry guitars and trilling stickwork referencing touchstones by Shellac, Slint and Fugazi.

In key with the emergence of notable band-style ensembles from London such as Mica Levi’s Good Sad Happy Bad, bar italia, or Still... more

label: Kranky
description:
Detroit dream pop duo Clinic Stars craft a love-letter to shoegaze's extended canon on their debut album, paying respects to Slowdive, Cocteau Twins, Julee Cruise and later genre upsetters Hood and Belong with richly layered ethereal reveries that hang in the air like silk.

Perfect Kranky material, 'Only Hinting' is a nostalgic blast of cool air that's refreshingly free of cynicism. Giovanna Lenski and Christian Molik haven't released much, but we can easily trace their inspirations - their last EP... more

label: wherethetimegoes
description:
Bit of a special one this; described as an avant-pop supergroup involving “serious legends”, Princ€ss land a strong debut album of modified shoegaze x ambient chamber musick slotted somewhere between Hysterical Love Project, Kevin Shields, A.R. Kane and Astrid Sonne, and tipped if yr on the spectrum between any of those trip/dream-pop integers.

OK what’s the craic here, then? As far as we can tell, Princ€ss are somehow related to shadowy label wherethetimegoes and wish to... more
